executive_summary: Short and concise executive summary (max 500 words). Advertising agencies have benefitted from rising consumer spending, corporate profit and per capita disposable income in recent years. Despite the outbreak of COVID-19 and falling advertising expenditure during the pandemic, revenue grew in 2020 as companies demanded creative services for COVID-19-focused marketing campaigns. As corporate profit returned following 2020, agencies were able to capitalize on an explosion of pent-up demand as businesses looked to target a consumer base with growing levels of disposable income. Industry-wide revenue has been growing at a CAGR of 2.7% over the past five years and is expected to total $70.1 billion in 2024, when revenue will jump by an estimated 1.9% and profit will inch toward 6.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Advertising agencies enjoyed heightened demand following the outbreak of COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While economic uncertainty and lower corporate profit amid the outbreak of COVID-19 reduced total advertising expenditure in 2020 as smaller businesses looked to cut additional costs, advertising agencies enjoyed growth. Much of the growth advertising companies enjoyed in 2020 was from larger companies seeking to capitalize on the swell in people's internet use.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital Advertising Led to Increased Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers spending more time at home than ever led to a boom in the consumption of streaming services, which led to an uptick in connected TV advertising, bolstering growth for advertising agencies. Larger companies demanded creative services for new COVID-19-focused marketing campaigns to make advertisements relevant to the current climate.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital Advertising Led to Increased Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent years, advertising expenditures for traditional media, such as magazines, newspapers and network TV, have declined. In contrast, internet ad spending has risen steadily over the past decade. According to the Interactive Advertising Bureau, in 2017, digital ad revenue overtook TV ad spending for the first time.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increasingly fragmented audiences have benefitted advertising agencies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The meteoric rise of digital media and more TV options means companies must contend with increasingly fragmented audiences. Growing audience fragmentation requires clients to purchase advertising space on an increasing number and types of platforms to achieve a wide-reaching message, expanding downstream customers' need for advertising companies for placement services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Advertising agencies had to shift alongside changing consumer behavior
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumer behavior has shifted considerably, forcing advertising agencies to rethink their practices and evolve to boost their efficacy. Video content has emerged as a dominant force in advertising, with agencies investing in video production and distribution across platforms like YouTube, TikTok and over-the-top streaming services.

Consumers' ability to skip ads on social media platforms and other websites like YouTube increased the need to focus on creative services to draw consumers in within the first few seconds of an advertisement. Many consumers even bypass advertisements on streaming services like Hulu and YouTube TV by paying a monthly subscription to give them ad-free viewing.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Seasonality Provides Timely Opportunities for Advertising Agencies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The US 2024 Election season will drive an explosion in political ad spending, compelling agencies to ramp up their resources and navigate stringent regulations. The 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris offers US brands an unparalleled opportunity to reach a global audience, emphasizing messages of unity, excellence and national pride.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Programmatic Ad Buying to Enable Larger Companies to Expand Their Market Share
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Programmatic ad buying is the use of automated technology for media buying. This technology gives advertisers access to a wide range of ad space inventory while providing a significant cost benefit compared to traditional ad-buying. Advertising agencies with the capital and willingness to incorporate such technology into their company will reap the benefits of this change.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Programmatic ad buying will threaten smaller advertising agencies
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Programmatic ad buying will threaten smaller advertising agencies since larger companies will pump capital into this practice to boost their market share, increasing consolation in the industry. Large technology companies, like Meta and Google, will siphon revenue away from small and medium-size advertising agencies through programmatic ad buying.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: V I R A L  M A R K E T I N G  W I L L  B O L S T E R  G R O W T H
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Unlike most online advertisements, which charge clients based on the number of consumer clicks, viral advertisements are passed from user to user via e-mail or social networking sites. Through social media, likes and shares allow advertisements to reach their intended target audience and expand into other audiences, boosting their efficacy and reach.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: N E W  F O R M S  O F  V I D E O  A D V E R T I S I N G  W I L L  P R O M O T E  G R O W T H
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in connected TV advertising will be a boon for advertising agencies in the next few years. According to the Interactive Advertising Bureau, connected TV advertising accounted for 18.0% of video advertising expenditure in 2022 and more than doubled from 2020 to 2022. Connected TV advertising expenditure will continue to expand since it provides data on customers' locations and browsing history without depending on third-party cookies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Advertising Agencies Will Increasingly Implement Artificial Intelligence (AI)
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advertising agencies will increasingly implement AI technology as a resource to perform tasks more quickly and effectively, enabling advertising agencies to focus on more value-added creative services and campaign strategies. Using AI to generate various types of content will mount, decreasing agencies' reliance on labor and boosting profit as wage costs climb.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Privacy and Competition Concerns Threaten the Future of Online Advertising Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the industry reaches a point of digital maturity and explosive online growth begins to peter out, internet advertising expansion from search and social platforms is also likely to be affected by regulatory concerns around privacy and competition. Growing customer distaste for invasive data practices has triggered significant changes in data regulations and tech company policies.

industry_definition: Advertising agencies create advertising campaigns for periodicals, newspapers, radio, TV and other media. Through in-house capabilities or subcontracting, ad agencies provide advice, creative services, account management, production of advertising material and media planning and buying (e.g. ad placement).

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Specialized niche agencies keep the market competitive. No single agency can dominate because businesses need tailored advertising solutions. Small agencies thrive by focusing on specific sectors, offering unique creativity and low-cost services.

Digital tools are leveling the playing field. Advanced analytics and digital platforms empower small agencies to deliver effective campaigns, allowing them to compete with industry giants by providing data-driven, personalized solutions.

A shift to digital advertising promoted growth for advertising agencies. As traditional media ad spending nosedived, digital advertising skyrocketed during the pandemic. Brands leaned into e-commerce and social media, tapping into the surge in online activity and streaming consumption.
New forms of marketing will continue to bolster growth. The increased use of viral marketing and investment into connected TV advertising will attract clients to advertising agencies.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The automotive sector has exhibited a steady need for advertising services. Many automotive companies have allocated more lavish advertising spending toward digital advertisements. As more automotive companies developed and released electric vehicles, their advertising needs rose as they pushed to promote their new products, invigorating demand for advertising agencies.

Retailers sell products to consumers and are the final step in merchandise distribution. Large companies in this market need advertising agencies to balance marketing their bricks-and-mortar locations and their e-commerce platforms. According to data from eMarketer, the retail sector has focused on advertisements related to search, mobile messaging, classifieds and directories. The growth in this segment is motivated by the popularity of online shopping and companies looking to maximize their online presence. This dynamic has been exacerbated by a surge in e-commerce activity facilitated by the pandemic.

Consumer packaged goods (CPG) are merchandise that customers frequently use and replace. This segment includes household cleaning products, cosmetics and personal care products. The CPG market constantly invests in marketing campaigns because of market saturation and consumers' frequent switching to products. According to a study by Cadent Consulting Group, surging e-commerce sales resulted in CPG marketers spending more on digital advertising than all forms of traditional marketing combined.

Companies in this market segment focus on creating cutting-edge technology. With the proliferation of mobile phones, this market has needed more advertising services over the past few years. The telecommunications sector will continue to grapple with advertising-related hurdles, like consumer sensitivity related to user privacy, limited mobile screen space and usability.

This segment's growth was significantly amplified by demand for healthcare services amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Advertisements in this sector include over-the-counter medicines and pharmaceutical companies advertising on industry-specific platforms. Pharmaceutical companies invest heavily in television advertising, accounting for 75.0% of all television advertising in the US. Advertising spending from healthcare and pharmaceutical companies increased because of the outbreak of COVID-19.

Companies in this market produce food and beverages. This sector is highly saturated and consumer switching costs are low, making the industry highly competitive. Companies in this segment spend a lot on marketing, promotion.

Financial services companies manage people's money and assets. Demand from this segment has risen and increased consumer exposure to financial instruments is poised to boost industry advertising budgets. The financial services sector has had to adjust to changes in how users access their financial information. People increasingly use their bank's mobile application to access their banking information, which has led many financial services companies to invest in mobile and internet advertisements.

This market includes clients in alcohol production and distribution, hospitality and food service, nonprofit organizations, governments and public institutions. Revenue volatility is reduced due to the industry's wide range of customers. The travel and hospitality sector makes up the most considerable portion of industry revenue among other markets. Companies in the travel and hospitality market heavily invest in advertising services to develop direct-response advertising to direct leads. Rich media, video and mobile-social displays from travel companies that want to establish a more substantial website presence are becoming more prominent. Travel and entertainment sunk alongside advertising and marketing for it in 2020 as the outbreak of COVID-19 halted large gatherings. Pent-up demand for these services led to a massive recovery in 2021 as the economy reopened.

products_and_services.product_description: Advertising agencies collaborate with clients to understand their vision, create a campaign strategy and concept and then create a finished product that conveys this message to the intended audience. Once the campaign is complete, advertising agencies provide media planning, buying and placement services, which involve negotiating, strategizing and purchasing ad placements.
Advertising agencies collaborate with clients to understand their vision, create a campaign strategy and concept and then create a finished product that conveys this message to the intended audience.

Media buying and planning involves negotiating, strategizing and purchasing ad placements. Media buying and planning strategies increasingly involve integrating multiple channels, including traditional media (TV, radio, print) and digital platforms (social media, search, display). Advertisers adopt omnichannel approaches to reach audiences at various touchpoints throughout their customer journey.

Advertising agencies offer other services ranging from integrated marketing services to specializing in a particular type of advertising. As global advertising agencies become more prevalent, offering many services has become more common.

tier_2_suppliers: Internet Publishing and Broadcasting in the US
Magazine & Periodical Publishing in the US
Billboard & Sign Manufacturing in the US
Database & Directory Publishing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Total advertising expenditure indicates spending on advertising, promotional and marketing activities. Mainstream media advertising trends, particularly in radio, TV, newspapers and magazines, directly influence this industry. Expansions to total US advertising expenditure indicate that businesses are more willing to incur advertising expenses, which benefits advertising agencies. Growth in total US advertising expenditure represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

In response to privacy concerns and regulatory changes, advertisers are exploring contextual targeting as an alternative to behavioral targeting. Contextual advertising considers the content and context of the web page or app where the ad appears, ensuring relevance while respecting user privacy.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast's massive population drives advertising agencies to the region. There's a high number of advertising agencies in Florida because it is a very densely populated state. Advertising agencies in the Southeast primarily consist of small operations serving many local businesses in the region.

The West has a heavy concentration of corporate advertisers and media production companies. California is home to many Advertising Agencies in the West, as many significant downstream markets are based there. Companies often work alongside influencers to promote a product or service. The West Coast, especially cities like Los Angeles and San Francisco, is a hub for the entertainment and tech industries, providing a rich client base for advertising agencies.

Advertising agencies establish themselves in the Mid-Atlantic to be close to major clients. The average establishment in this region is considerably larger than in other areas because of the concentration of major media outlets, advertising agencies and global corporate clients, particularly in New York City. Most businesses in the region are in New York because there is a high concentration of major clients in New York City.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Google has set some standards for advertising agencies. As of 2016, Google no longer permits pharmaceutical companies to use vanity URLs and advertisements about dietary supplements and environmental claims are strictly regulated. In 2018, Google released a built-in ad-blocker on its Chrome browser to filter out spam-like advertisements. As many US internet users use Chrome, ad-makers must ensure that their advertisements adhere to Google's policies.

The FTC Act requires advertising to be truthful and nondeceptive. Advertising a product or service that misleads consumers, causes unavoidable consumer injury, makes false claims, fails to provide vital information or misrepresents a product's performance, features, safety, price, or effectiveness is noncompliant with the FTC's regulations. The FTC also requires advertising agencies to provide disclosure statements if consumer confusion is possible.

The GDPR is a data protection regulation implemented in Europe in 2018. The GDPR allows users to better their data, which may hurt advertising agencies since targeted ads use user data. Though the regulation applies only to EU citizens, some internet companies have expanded laws worldwide, which may impact the US.
This regulation governs commercial email communications, ensuring that marketing emails are clearly identified as such, include the sender's valid

The NAD offers a self-regulatory mechanism for resolving disputes concerning advertising claims. It provides a structured opportunity to address and correct any misleading content before the issue is escalated to the FTC. Agencies should continuously review and adhere to NAD recommendations. Following these guidelines helps maintain advertising integrity and avoids potential regulatory scrutiny.

Advertisements for alcohol and tobacco products are subject to stringent regulations that promote responsible marketing. These regulations often restrict targeting to adults and require health warnings. Non-compliance can result in significant fines, product withdrawal, and damage to the agency's credibility. Agencies must ensure their campaigns comply with these rules to uphold public responsibility and avoid legal issues.

In January of 2024, Publicis Health, one of the largest global health advertising agencies, will pay $350 million to settle allegations it "developed predatory and deceptive marketing strategies" for Purdue Pharma opioids. The advertising agency is also prohibited from "accepting any future contracts or engagements" involving opioid marketing or sale and must release internal documents related to its work with manufacturers and consultants. The landmark decision could set a precedent for future prosecution of advertising agencies deemed to use deceptive tactics.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The level of industry assistance is low and steady.

basis_points.basis_title: Specialized niche agencies keep the market competitive
basis_points.basis_description: No single agency can dominate because businesses need tailored advertising solutions. Small agencies thrive by focusing on specific sectors, offering unique creativity and low-cost services.

basis_points.basis_title: Digital tools are leveling the playing field
basis_points.basis_description: Advanced analytics and digital platforms empower small agencies to deliver effective campaigns, allowing them to compete with industry giants by providing data-driven, personalized solutions.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The Strong Performance of Niche Advertising Agencies Keeps Concentration Low
concentration_points.concentration_description: The advertising world caters to businesses of all sizes, from local mom-and-pop shops to multinational giants. This means no single agency can corner every market. Agencies often specialize in niche markets or specific industries, keeping the field fragmented and competitive.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Data Driven Strategies Level the Playing Field
concentration_points.concentration_description: Digital technology has democratized the advertising space, enabling smaller agencies to access tools and platforms that were once only available to industry giants. Social media, SEO and programmatic advertising technologies allow even boutique agencies to deliver highly effective campaigns, diminishing the advantage previously held by larger agencies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor intensity complicates entry, as advertising agencies depend on skilled professionals. For instance, hiring top-tier talent such as experienced copywriters, creative directors and data analysts demands competitive wages as a share of revenue have decreased as less labor-intensive programmatic advertising and data analytics software overtake manual digital ad space buying and campaign results tracking.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Drop as Service Offerings Evolve
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The surge in popularity of digital media has decreased purchase costs in recent years, as it is much cheaper than printed advertisements. Advertising agencies' increased use of viral marketing has also decreased purchase costs as they leverage the reach of the internet to circumvent the high costs of traditional ad placements.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The usage of consumer tracking technology
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Tracking technology enables advertisers to direct marketing and advertising campaigns to consumers more likely to purchase the promoted product. Increasing the accuracy of advertisements to targeted markets boosts the efficacy of ads. This increased efficacy benefits downstream customers and advertising agencies' reputations.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Digital advertising on social media platforms
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Using social media platforms to incorporate viral marketing campaigns is an effective advertising strategy. For example, industry major Publicis Groupe partnered with tech giants like Meta and Microsoft to strengthen its digital portfolio.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Total Advertising Expenditure Impacts Volatility Considerably
volatility_points.volatility_description: Seasonality and special events have a considerable effect on total media expenditure. Political spending increases in election years and holiday spending increases during winter. Advertising activity for large companies surges during sporting events like the Olympic Games or the Super Bowl.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Constant Tech Evolution Shifts Ad Spending
volatility_points.volatility_description: Rapid technological changes mean agencies must adapt, often overhauling their strategies and tools. This can lead to unpredictable expenses and revenues as they invest in new platforms and training.

FAQs.question: How have economic changes influenced consumer demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: Growth in total US advertising expenditure indicates that businesses are more willing to incur advertising expenses, which benefits advertising agencies.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer a broad range of services or specialize in a particular niche?
FAQs.answer: Large companies can have more staff to provide a range of services in-house. Most companies have less than 10 employees and focus on one industry service or client industry.

FAQs.question: Has your company pursued merger and acquisition strategies to gain market share and improve efficiency?
FAQs.answer: Big companies are aggressively purchasing small digital and social media advertising firms to adapt to the changing way people consume media.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: Labor is the biggest expense for a typical firm. Employees provide extensive creative work, advice and market research which cannot be fully automated.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness? How has your company adapted to virtual working?
FAQs.answer: Computers assist in campaign design processes. As the world becomes more globalized, technology allows advertisers to reach broader audiences.

FAQs.question: Have increased levels of technological innovation/development presented any obstacles for your company? To what degree has your company been impacted by the rise in programmatic advertising? Has this posed an advantage or obstacle? Do you experience external competition from Google Ads?
FAQs.answer: There are now numerous channels on TV as well as internet sources to consume media. Companies must be able to still deliver for their clients and reach a high level of viewers despite this fragmentation. Programmatic advertising and Google Ads have posed increasingly larger external threats to industry operators over the last several years.

FAQs.question: What are the toughest regulatory requirements that your company experiences?
FAQs.answer: The Federal Trade Commission requires advertising to be truthful and nondeceptive. Certain products (i.e. pharmaceuticals, alcohol and tobacco) have their own regulations on how they can be advertised and companies must adhere to those rules.

FAQs.question: Over the past five years, has the regulatory environment changed significantly or has it remained relatively
FAQs.answer: Regulation of advertisements does not change significantly. Companies must always be sure to not make false claims and mislead consumers in any way. Ads on social media must be stated explicitly as such.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with those of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: For larger operators, profit typically varies between 10.0% and 15.0% of revenue. Small agencies that provide specialized services, such as search engine optimization, are unable to garner profit margins like larger operators that provide more in-house services.

FAQs.question: What services or client groups command the highest margins? What investments (either technology or otherwise) have generated the largest profit returns for your company?
FAQs.answer: Profit varies for industry operators depending on the type of client and the size of their ad campaigns, as well as by type of services provided. There are some industries and clients who investment more in advertising than others, generating more profit for industry operators. Investments in new technologies or new acquisitions are undertaken with the goal of profit generation in mind.

FAQs.question: How do you incorporate popular culture and economic trends into your advertising and ideation process?
FAQs.answer: Providing clients with unique ideas of how to promote their product can help agencies secure and retain clients.

FAQs.question: How has your company adapted to compete with rising demand for digital advertising? How are you able to quickly adopt to new technology?
FAQs.answer: Digital advertising poses a rising source of internal and external competition for industry operators. This has changed the ways ads are created, measured and paid for, as well as opened up new channels (ex social media).

FAQs.question: How do you keep track of ad performance? How does this differ between digital advertising and more traditional channels?
FAQs.answer: It is essential that the operator be able to show clients the results of their spending and the direct results (on sales and brand awareness) of the company's campaign. Digital advertising offers new ways of measuring ad performance that are not available for traditional forms, such as impressions, cost-per-thousand impression (CPM), clicks and cost-per-click (CPC), among many others.

FAQs.question: How has your company been affected by investor uncertainty? How do you encourage marketing spending when investor uncertainty is high?
FAQs.answer: As investor uncertainty increases, companies may be less willing to incur nonessential expenditures such as advertising.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising corporate profit levels? How do you appeal to large corporations?
FAQs.answer: During periods of higher profitability, businesses are more willing to expand their advertising budgets due to many digital advertising services resulting in a strong return on their investment.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of total US advertising expenditure? How will you take advantage of higher advertising expenditure?
FAQs.answer: Growth in total US advertising expenditure indicates that businesses are more willing to incur advertising expenses, which benefits advertising agencies.
